Additional Metrics Information

Drainage area to BMP (DA, sf): For a raingarden, this is generally the areal portion of a rooftop, driveway, or parking area whose runoff is diverted into the BMP.

Area of the BMP (sf): This is the area of the BMP itself, typically measured as length times width in square feet.

Roof top drainage area (sf): This is the total rooftop area draining to rain barrels or disconnected from the storm drain.

Area of BMP (sf): This is the length times width of the area where permeable pavement is being installed, or impervious cover is being removed.

Area of BMP (sf): This is the lawn area being managed with either nutrient management or conservation landscaping.

Number of trees: The number of new trees planted around your property.

No. of observed bird or small animal species: As your raingarden and conservation landscaping mature, count the number of bird and other animal species that begin to populate your yard.

Adaptive management checks: Summary Field Sheet (above); CSN, 2013; CSN, 2014; Sellner et al., 2012.
